hypothesis_content.title: Cross-Asset Liquidity Shock Propagation
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, when BTC experiences a liquidity shock (bid-ask spread widens >150% of 7-day average with >2% price move), ETH will experience amplified move (1.3-1.8x) in same direction within 30 minutes as shock propagates through correlated liquidity pools.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress regimes feature correlated liquidity withdrawal. BTC shocks propagate to ETH via cross-margin calls, ETF arbitrage, and shared market maker pools. The amplification factor captures ETH's higher beta during stress.
entry_conditions: Market regime = STRESS (VIX > 25 or Crypto Fear & Greed < 25)
Entry on ETH in same direction after 5-minute confirmation

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH move reaches 1.5x BTC's initial shock move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH reverses 50% of initial shock propagation move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Shocks fail to propagate (>40% of cases) or propagate with <1.1x amplification during verified stress events.
